meanings.definition: To draw off (liquid) by means of a siphon or tube.
meanings.sent1: I will vint the water from the bucket into the sink.
meanings.sent2: She used a tube to vint the oil from the container.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to vint the juice from a stone, but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to vint the happiness from the room.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum cleaner vinted up all the dirt from the carpet.

meanings.definition: To draw off (liquid) by means of a siphon or tube.
meanings.sent1: He carefully vinted the liquid into a smaller bottle.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to vint the old oil from the engine.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to vint the sauce using a straw, which was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to vint away all his worries.
meanings.sent5: The straw vinted the last drops of soda from the glass.

meanings.definition: To draw off (liquid) by means of a siphon or tube.
meanings.sent1: They needed to vint the liquid before transferring it to another container.
meanings.sent2: The winemaker had to vint the wine carefully to avoid spillage.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to vint the milk from the bowl using a straw, but ended up with a wet nose.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to vint the energy from the room, leaving everyone silent.
meanings.sent5: The straw vinted the last remnants of the smoothie from the cup.
